definitions.definition: a position in the hierarchy of the armed forces.
examples: an army officer of fairly high rank

definitions.definition: a position within the hierarchy of an organization or society.
examples: only two cabinet members had held ministerial rank before
synonyms: standing; datedstation "she was elevated to an administrative rank"

definitions.definition: a number specifying position in a numerically ordered series.
a single line of soldiers or police officers drawn up abreast.
examples: row, line, file, column, string, train, procession a rank of riflemen

definitions.definition: common soldiers as opposed to officers.
the people belonging to or constituting a group or class.
a regular row or line of things or people.
examples: conifer plantations growing in serried ranks

definitions.definition: each of the eight rows of eight squares running from side to side across a chessboard.
the value or the order of the largest nonzero determinant of a given matrix.
an analogous quantity in other kinds of groups.
give (someone or something) a rank or place within a grading system.
examples: rank them in order of preference
synonyms: list "this orchid is ranked as endangered"

definitions.definition: have a specified rank or place within a grading system.
examples: he ranks with Newman as one of the outstanding English theologians
synonyms: be categorized; belong "she ranked below the others"

definitions.definition: take precedence over (someone) in respect to rank; outrank.
examples: the Secretary of State ranks all the other members of the cabinet

definitions.definition: arrange in a rank or ranks.
examples: the tents were ranked in orderly rows
synonyms: list; triage "he ranked them in order of experience"
